alternative_title: Employers' tax and reporting for items for disabled employees
body:
$!As an employer, if you provide equipment or services to a disabled employee so they can do their work, it doesn't count as a taxable expense or benefit.$!

This means:

+ you don't have to report it to HMRC
+ you don't pay tax or National Insurance on it

This doesn't change if your employee also uses the equipment or services outside work. However, you must offer it on similar terms to any other employee who is or becomes disabled.

Different rules apply if you [provide a car to a disabled employee](/expenses-and-benefits-company-cars "provide a car to a disabled employee").

##Technical guidance

The following guide contains more detailed information:

+ [Particular benefits: exemption for equipment or services provided to employees with a disability](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/eim21846.htm "Particular benefits: exemption for equipment or services provided to employees with a disability"){:rel="external"}

*[HMRC]: HM Revenue & Customs
